incidents.name: Database issues on Ninetailed Management API

incident_updates.body: Ninetailed management API experienced a partial outage due to database issues.

incidents.name: Issues uploading assets

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved.
Some users may have encountered issues uploading assets to Contentful. A change has been put in place, but users may need to refresh the page if they are still encountering this error.

incidents.name: Increased latency and timeouts for Management, Preview and Delivery APIs

incident_updates.body: The increased error rate and latency was confirmed to be subsided.
We observed recovery for the past 30 minutes. We are monitoring the situation and investigating further the cause to prevent it to resurface.
We identified an increase of latency and timeouts on the Management and Preview Content APIs. We are investigating the root cause.

incidents.name: GraphQL errors for requests containing Shopify data queries.

incident_updates.body:
We identified an issue that occurred on Jan. 21st between 14:29 (UTC) and 18:09 (UTC) where our GraphQL Delivery API was returning error responses for requests containing Shopify data queries.
A fix was deployed which resolved the issue, and we are continuing to investigate the root cause in depth.

incidents.name: Web app responsivenes

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Some users might experience degradation in the web app's responsiveness. We are investigating the issue.

components.name: Web App

incidents.name: Transactional emails not being sent

incident_updates.body: Transactional emails are fully operational again.
We have identified an issue where transactional emails are not being sent. This means that newly added users may not be receiving invitational emails.

components.name: Transactional Emails
components.description: New user invitation emails, password reset emails as well as email notifications sent as a result of changes to Tasks, Comments or Workflows.

incidents.name: Transactional emails not being sent for Tasks, Comments and Workflows

incident_updates.body: All transactional emails are being sent out again for changes to workflows, tasks and comments.

We have an ongoing partial outage on transactional emails. Customers are no longer receiving email notifications as a result of changes to workflows, tasks or comments. Customers will need to go into the Contentful WebApp to review the state of tasks, comments or workflows as a result. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.

components.name: Transactional Emails
components.description: New user invitation emails, password reset emails as well as email notifications sent as a result of changes to Tasks, Comments or Workflows.

incidents.name: Transactional Emails outage

incident_updates.body: Transactional emails are fully operational again.
Transactional emails are not being processed by our email provider. Password reset emails, invites, task mentions and similar notifications are impacted.

incidents.name: Missing fields from Content APIs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The cache purge was completed and we confirmed the recovery of the missing fields. We will continue to monitor the recovery for the next few minutes.
We have deployed a fix for the issue. We are in the process of purging all the cache for malformed responses, which should be the last step of the mitigation.
We discovered an issue in our Content APIs that resulted in some fields being omitted in the API response. We have identified the causing issue and are working on a change.

incidents.name: Delays in Content type changes being reflected in GraphQL API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been deployed which has resolved the issue. We are running a job to pick up all content type changes which were made but not reflected in GraphQL API in the past hour. This will be completed in the next 30 mins. (Customer affected can also republish their content types again if they don't wish to wait).
Some customers may be experiencing delays in changes to their content types being reflected in the GraphQL Content API. We have identified the cause and are working on mitigating the issue

incidents.name: Stale HTTP 400 Responses being returned by Contentful GraphAPI

incident_updates.body: We discovered a bug that could have resulted in stale 400 responses being returned by the Contentful GraphAPI. It has been resolved and the stale responses have been purged from the cache.

incidents.name: Introspection queries in Graph-API returned stale content for some customers

incident_updates.body: We have identified that introspection queries in Graph-API were returning stale content for a subset of customers. The issue has been identified and a fix has been rolled out.

incidents.name: Stale cache on GraphQL requests with external references

incident_updates.body: Incident is now resolved.
A fix has been deployed, we are monitoring the situation.
We have noticed an issue with external references, that might lead to external content being stale. We are working on a fix.

incidents.name: Errors uploading files on Contentful WebApp

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been resolved and uploads on the Contentful WebApp are back to normal working state.

While our mitigation has resolved the issue of customers receiving errors when uploading assets, the following functionality is not currently available. 
- Rotate/Resize/Crop Images in the Contentful WebApp
- Upload of images from third parties
We continue to work on this issue.
Customers who are still experiencing errors uploading files to Contentful WebApp should refresh the page and retry the upload.
Some customers are experiencing errors when uploading files to Contentful WebApp. We have initiated a temporary mitigation (which is limited to direct uploads).

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for our CDA and Images API for some customers.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved, and our services have been fully restored.
We see traffic recovering to normal levels and are monitoring the situation.
We see the errors recovering slowly on the side of our upstream providers. Additionally, we're working on our side on mitigating the issue.
We're investigating elevated error rates for our CDA and Images API. We suspect that the cause is an incident on one of our upstream CDN providers.

incidents.name: Delayed cache invalidation after content publish

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We scaled the cache invalidation infrastructure for the affected customers and saw the back pressure of the queues come back down to normal levels. We continue to monitor the situation, so the issue doesn't reappear.

We're investigating an issue where a small minority of our customers might see delayed cache invalidation on our content delivery network after publish that might result in some of their end users seeing stale content for longer than expected.

incidents.name: Spike in errors on Contentful Delivery APIs

incident_updates.body: Between 14:50 and 14:55 (UTC) some customers spaces on shared infrastructure experienced a spike in errors across our Content Delivery APIs (Content Delivery API, GraphQL Delivery API). The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased errors on on GraphAPI

incident_updates.body: Between 12:36 and 12:56(UTC) customers on our shared infrastructure experienced elevated errors on our GraphAPI. We applied a fix for the issue and the API is operating as normal again.

incidents.name: Publishing delays for some Team tier customers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Some customers on our Team tier as still experiencing issues where they can publish successfully but the cache is not purged immediately so the are receiving stale content from Contentful's Delivery APIs. 
We have identified the cause of the issue and are working on a fix.
We are investigating an issue where a subset of customers (on Team tier) are experiencing delays with publishing and content being out of date.

incidents.name: Elevated GraphQL error rates.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We see all systems fully operational again.

The elevated errors were caused by a faulty GraphQL node and affected a small single digit percentage of requests only. We resolved the problem and are monitoring the situation to ensure the error doesn't reappear.
We're currently investigating a single digit percentage increase above normal GraphQL error rates.

incidents.name: Unexpected "Premium expired" message on entries

incident_updates.body: This message has been removed.

Some users of the Conditional Fields by Prototyp app may notice the message "Premium expired! Conditions are disabled. Renew your subscription or remove all premium rules" on fields. This message is related to your subscription to the Conditional Fields service and not your subscription to Contentful. If you see this banner, there is no issue with your Contentful account.
